intro: Oreocarya interrupta, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California and Nevada. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open slopes, adapting to the harsh conditions of high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or white with five petals. Oreocarya interrupta plays an important role in pollination and serves as a food source for local wildlife.
